factMT: L-elezzjonijiet ġenerali tal-1987 hi l-unika darba meta kkontesta il-Partit Komunista Malti.

questionContent: Which of the following Maltese general elections was highly disputed after the Nationalist Party secured an absolute majority of votes, but won less seats than the Labour Party?
questionContentMT: L-elezzjonijiet ġenerali ta' liema sena raw kontroversja wara il-Partit Nazzjonalista kiseb il-maġġoranza tal-voti, izda rebaħ inqas siġġijiet fil-Parlament mill-Partit Laburista?
fact: Changes were later made to the voting system to prevent a recurrence of the same problem, in which the party supported by an overall majority of voters is awarded a number of additional seats from a party list, in order to secure a parliamentary majority.
factMT: Biex dil-problema ma tirrepetix, kienu saru ċerti bidliet fis-sistema tal-votazzjoni, fej il-partit li jirbaħ il-maġġoranza tal-voti jingħata numru ta' siġġijiet żejda sabiex jassigura maġġoranza parlamentari.

questionContent: What was the colloquial Maltese name of the Constitutional Party?
questionContentMT: X'kien l-isem kollokwali Malti tal-Partit Kostituzzjonali?
fact: Having pro-British ideals in common, the "Stricklandjani" formed a coalition government with the Labour Party between 1927 and 1932 (although only until 1930, due to the first Interdict).
factMT: Peress li t-tnejn li huma qasmu ideoloġija favur l-Inglizi f'Malta, is-Stricklandjani ffurmaw gvern ta' koalizzjoni mal-Partit Laburista bej il-1927 u l-1932 (iżda biss sal-1930, minħabba l-Ewwel Interdett)

questionContent: As of 2021, by what party, and what year was the largest electoral victory in Malta's history?
questionContentMT: Qabel l-2021, minn liema partit, u f'liema sena seħħet l-ikbar rebħa elettorali fl-istorja ta' Malta?
fact: At one point during the 2017 vote counting process, a projected gap in excess of 51,500 votes prompted Prime Minister Joseph Muscat to erroneously declare it the widest margin in Malta's electoral history.
factMT: F'ċertu punt waqt il-process tal-għadd tal-voti f'2017, marġini proġettat ta' 51,500 vot wassal il-Prim Ministru Joseph Muscat biex b’mod żbaljat jiddikjara bħala l-akbar rebħa fl-istorja elettorali ta' Malta.

questionContent: As of 2021, which of Malta's Prime Ministers served the longest?
questionContentMT: Qabel l-2021, liema Prim Ministru Malti serva għal-itwal żmien?

factMT: Eddie Fenech Adami serva għal approssimativament 20 sena, Dom Mintoff governa għal xi 16-il sena u Ġorġ Borg Olivier serva ghal qrib ta' 15-il sena.

questionContent: Which of the following statements about the (Second) Interdict (1961-1969) is NOT true?
questionContentMT: Liema frażijiet dwar (It-Tieni) Interdett (1961-1969) mhux vera?

answers.answerContent: Archbishop Gonzi's desires to diminish the Labour Party would succeed, for the Labour Party would not be elected for another 10 years after the interdict was lifted
answers.answerContentMT: Ix-xewqat tal-Arċisqof Gonzi li jkisser il-Partit Laburista kienu suċċess, u ma reġax ġie elett ghal 10 snin ohra wara li tneħħa l-Interdett

answers.answerContent: Interdicted Labour Party supporters were not able to receive sacraments, nor get married in Church, and had to be buried in unconsecrated ground called "Il-Miżbla"
answers.answerContentMT: Il-partitarji tal-Partit Laburista interdetti ma setgħux jirċievu s-sagramenti, u lanqas jiżżewġu fil-Knisja, u kellhom jiġu midfuna f'art mhux ikkonkreta msejħa "Il-Miżbla"

answers.answerContent: The Church reinforced fears of Mintoff being a closet communist, and disrupted Labour rallies with continous ringing of churchbells
answers.answerContentMT: Il-Knisja saħħet il-biżgħat tal-involviment Sovjetiku u li Mintoff komunist, u ħarbtet il-mass meetings Laburisti b'daqq kontinwu tal-qniepen tal-knisja

answers.answerContent: Despite the Nationalists never opposing the decree publicly, Guido de Marco showed solidarity with the interdicted Joe Micallef Stafrace at his shunned wedding in a church sacristy
answers.answerContentMT: Minkejja li n-Nazzjonalisti qatt ma opponew l-Interdett pubblikament, Guido de Marco wera solidarjetà mal-interdett Joe Micallef Stafrace fit-tieġ tiegħu f'sagristija tal-knisja

questionContent: Who did the Church declare the First Interdict (1930-1932) against?
questionContentMT: Il-Knisja ddikjarat l-Ewwel Interdett (1930-1932) kontra ...

answers.answerContent: Constitutional Party and its allies, the Labour Party
answers.answerContentMT: Il-Partit Kostituzzjonali u l-alleati tiegħu, il-Partit Laburista

fact: The Church was successful, as Strickland's Constitutional Party lost five seats in the 1932 general election.
factMT: Il-Knisja kienet irnexxielha, hekk kif il-Partit Kostituzzjonali ta' Strickland tilef ħames siġġijiet fl-elezzjoni ġenerali tal-1932.

questionContent: As of 2021, which of the following is the oldest daily newspaper still in circulation in Malta?
questionContentMT: Qabel l-2021, liema hija l-eqdem gazzetta ta' kuljum li għadha fiċ-ċirkolazzjoni f’Malta?
fact: Like Times of Malta, "Il-Berqa" was a Maltese daily newspaper also published by Allied Newspapers.
factMT: Bħal Times of Malta, "Il-Berqa" kienet gazzetta ta' kuljum Maltija ppubblikata wkoll minn Allied Newspapers.

questionContentMT: Fl-1942, 43 Malti suspettati b’simpatiji faxxisti u tradiment ġew deportati illegalment mill-gvern Ingliż lejn ...
fact: Some notable internees were Enrico Mizzi, would go on to become Malta's Prime Minister, and Catholic politician Herbert Ganado.
factMT: Xi internati notevoli kienu Nerik Mizzi, li wara leħaq Prim Ministru ta' Malta, u l-politiku Kattoliku Herbert Ganado.

questionContent: How was the fascist Carmelo Borg Pisani executed after being condemned to death for treason in 1942?

fact: As of 2021, Carmelo Borg Pisani was the last person in Malta's history to be executed for a crime other than murder.
factMT: Qabel l-2021, Carmelo Borg Pisani kien l-aħħar persuna fl-istorja ta' Malta li ġiet eżegwita għal reat ieħor ħlief qtil.

questionContent: Joseph Howard was Malta's first ...
questionContentMT: Joseph Howard kien l-ewwel ...
fact: As his first act as Prime Minister, Howard proclaimed Roman Catholicism as the official religion of the country.
factMT: Bħala l-ewwel att tiegħu bħala Prim Ministru, Howard ipproklama l-Kattoliċiżmu Ruman bħala r-reliġjon uffiċjali tal-pajjiż.

questionContent: What secret 1916 treaty shaped the Ottoman Empire into partitions in the event of an Ottoman defeat, and is considered by many to be the cause of current conflict in the Middle East?
fact: The agreement was made public by the Bolsheviks in 1917.

questionContent: Which of the following is a disease that mainly affected workers in the matchstick industry in the 19th and early 20th centuries?
fact: It was caused by exposure to white phosphorus vapour, which led to swelling, abscesses, formation of dead bone separated from living bone, and finally necrosis.

questionContent: What is a pejorative term for unstructured and difficult-to-maintain source code, usually due to misuse of code structures?
What is "lasagna code"?

answers.answerContent: Programs whose structure consists of too many layers of inheritance
Programs whose structure is barely comprehensible
Code which contains repetitive patterns and substrings over again
Retaining a part of a system that no longer has any use

questionContent: What is "hard coding"?

answers.answerContent: Embedding data directly into the source code of a program or other executable object, as opposed to obtaining the data from external sources or generating it at runtime
Code whose layers are so complicated and intertwined that making a change in one layer would necessitate changes in all other layers
Code which contains repetitive patterns and substrings over again
Copying (and modifying) existing code rather than creating generic solutions

questionContent: What is a "magic number"?

answers.answerContent: The anti-pattern of using numbers directly in source code, which obscures developers' intent in choosing that number
Code whose layers are so complicated and intertwined that making a change in one layer would necessitate changes in all other layers
Encoding a set of sequential steps using a switch within a loop statement
Copying (and modifying) existing code rather than creating generic solutions

questionContent: What is a "magic string"?

answers.answerContent: Implementing presumably unlikely input scenarios, such as comparisons with very specific strings, to mask functionality
Catching an error message before it can be shown to the user and either showing nothing or showing a meaningless message
Encoding a set of sequential steps using a switch within a loop statement

questionContent: What is "accidental complexity"?

answers.answerContent: Programming tasks which could be eliminated with better tools, as opposed to essential complexity inherent in the problem being solved
Unexpected interaction between widely separated parts of a system
Adding new code to handle each special case as it is recognized
Encoding a set of sequential steps using a switch within a loop statement

questionContent: What is the principle of DRY?
What solution would be a violation of the DRY principle?
What phrase is used to describe the rule of thumb when to use a loop?

answers.answerContent: Two or more, use a for

questionContent: What phrase is used to describe retaining a part of a system that no longer has any use?
What phrase is used to describe retaining redundant or poor-quality code because removing it is too expensive or has unpredictable consequences?
What is "cargo cult progamming"?

answers.answerContent: Using patterns and methods without understanding why
Copying (and modifying) existing code rather than creating generic solutions
Assuming that a favorite solution is universally applicable
Coding early-on for perceived efficiency, sacrificing good design, maintainability, and sometimes even real-world efficiency

questionContent: What is the phrase describing the cognitive bias that a favorite technical solution can solve a larger process or problem?
What is the colloquial phrase describing problems with versions of install software packages?
What does "Moore's law" state?

answers.answerContent: The number of transistors in a dense integrated circuit doubles about every two years
As disk drive density improves, storage will become cheaper
Programs that send messages to other programs should conform completely to the specifications, but programs that receive messages should accept non-conformant input as long as the meaning is clear
If inputs meet valid input thresholds, then the system guarantees outputs will meet valid output thresholds

questionContent: Which of the following do NOT represent the principle KISS?
What does "Kryder's law" state?

answers.answerContent: Disk drive density doubles every thirteen months, and as disk drive density improves, storage will become cheaper
The number of transistors in a dense integrated circuit doubles about every two years
Programs that send messages to other programs should conform completely to the specifications, but programs that receive messages should accept non-conformant input as long as the meaning is clear
If inputs meet valid input thresholds, then the system guarantees outputs will meet valid output thresholds

questionContent: What law states that software is getting slower more rapidly than hardware is becoming faster?
What is "rubber ducking"?

answers.answerContent: Method of debugging code by having to explain it, line-by-line, to a rubber duck (or any inanimate object)
Method of bug-solving by relieving stress after squeezing a rubber duck
Method of code formatting by hotkeying a shortcut to a rubber duck
Code compilation through the Rubber Duck plug-in

fact: By using an inanimate object, the programmer can try to accomplish this without having to interrupt anyone else.

questionContent: Which programming language was designed with the motto "There's more than one way to do it" in mind?
Which of the following principles from the Zen of Python, contrasts the programming motto TMTOWDI?

answers.answerContent: There should be one– and preferably only one –obvious way to do it

questionContent: What is an extended acronym given to the largest and most prominent company stocks in the IT industry of the United States?
Debuting in 1972, what was the first commercial home video game console?
fact: The Odyssey came packaged with game cards, plastic overlays (to be placed on a screen to display additional visual elements for each game), dice, paper money as well as other board game paraphernalia.

questionContent: Which country possesses the largest maritime territory?
fact: France's maritime territory covers 11.7 kilometres squared.

questionContent: Which one of these four U.S. states does NOT use the designation 'Commonwealth' to define themselves?
fact: Kentucky, Massachusetts, Virginia and Pennsylvania are the only four U.S. states to be referred to as a 'Commonwealth'.

questionContent: Which one of these languages did NOT historically use Arabic script before adopting a Cyrillic writing system?
fact: The Georgian language has always used its own script as its writing system, and still does.

questionContent: What was the name of the drummer for the Beatles that was replaced by Ringo Starr?
What year does Grand Theft Auto: Vice City take place?
Which U.S. state does the TV series Breaking Bad primarily take place?
Which country's air force adopted the swastika before Nazi Germany in 1918?
fact: The Finnish air force would bear a blue swastika on their planes until 1945, and not fully discontinue the unit emblem until 2020.

questionContent: What car released in the 1970s was notorious for exploding on rear end collisions?
What is believed to be the first official website of a mainstream band?
fact: Released on October 31, 1994, the first official band website is believed to have been called Megadeth Arizona.

questionContent: Finish the lyric: "Hanging on in quiet desperation..."
What car would become rebadged and released as the first iteration of the Volkswagen Polo?
Which Green Day album is said to have had its master tapes stolen?
Which nation suffered the most casualties in World War II by an incredible margin?
fact: The Soviet Union is estimated to have suffered 20-27 million casualties during World War II, 13.7% of its 1940 population.

questionContent: Which modern nations was French Indochina NOT comprised of?
What is the capital city of Vietnam?
fact: Prior to Vietnamese independence, Ho Chi Minh City was referred to as Saigon.

questionContent: What actor was originally meant to voice Shrek before their untimely demise?
Which of these films is NOT a film directed by Martin Scorsese?
What is name of Google's parent company?
What is name of the first car the player drives in Grand Theft Auto III?
Which one of these Soviet satellites states did NOT reject Soviet doctrine before the collapse of the U.S.S.R.?
fact: Albania, Romania and Yugoslavia all shook off Soviet control in 1961, 1965 and 1948 respectively.

questionContent: What does the political role of 'Taoiseach' in Ireland represent?
With what camera was the album cover of Neil Young's Silver & Gold captured?
Where were most of the scenes featuring Tatooine in Star Wars (1977) filmed in?
fact: While most of Tatooine was shot in Tunisia, some scenes were filmed in Death Valley, California.

questionContent: What was the official name of Joseph Stalin's position of power in the Soviet Union?
What was the official name of Mao Zedong's position of power in China?
What was the official name of Muammar Gaddafi's position of power in Libya after 1979?
Which of these socialist state leaders did Dom Mintoff NOT meet with?
questionContentMT: Liema minn dawn il-mexxejja soċjalisti ma 'ltaqax magħhom Dom Mintoff?
